Reviews.Title: “Not in the countryside, but well worth a visit!”
Reviews.Author: CleoCairo
Reviews.Content: I arrived early evening at the hotel and the Check In staff were extremely helpful and courteous. They upgraded my Deluxe room to an Executive Suite which was extremely large comprising of a living room, 2 bathrooms, large bedroom and balcony. The room also had 2 tv's with a wide variety of satellite channels. The room service food was delivered promptly and very reasonable (it also was inclusive of all taxes) and was delivered promptly along with complimentary ice. My room was on the 2nd floor and it was very quiet (considering the multiple restaurants, bars and club within the hotel). The buffet breakfast (an added extra when booking the room) was delicious and there was a wide variety of options available. Check out was efficient and stress free! All in all a great hotel which I would recommend with a good location (close to Bur Dubai and the bus station). The staff also allowed me to store my luggage after I had checked out which was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anubhav K
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and good service. big spacious rooms and nice sauna bath.

Reviews.Title: “Cheerful and very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: luxielu
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay here! I paid 400 pounds for 6 nights (there is 20% tax put on as all hotels will) so was more than the travago advertised. However, it was clean, I was allowed to smoke in my room... but you can ask for non-smoking. The pool is small but clean and perfect if you are looking to chill for a couple of hours before going out. It has a mixture of guests from business to tourists from all other. There is a good Indian restaurant. I didn't go in the English pub (it sounded like there was a lot of karaoke going on! However, I would make sure you get a room on the 3rd floor to avoid being disturbed by any music from the clubs. It may feel like its miles from anywhere. But then that is the case of most hotels in Dubai! Taxis are easy to flag down.. and the doormen are always there to do the honours for you. I never paid more than 2 pounds to get where I wanted to be. They also run a shuttle bus to the beach all day. I took advantage of the spa... had an amazing body massage and foot massage which was really cheap as they were having 50% off all treatments All in all... the hotel was just what I wanted as somewhere reasonably priced and a good base for Dubai creek area.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming hotel, wide room”
Reviews.Author: Magdaba
Reviews.Content: The country club hotel it's great! Very spacious, clean and confortable room. We also paid for the breakfast, you can eat and drink what you want, continental and arab food are served and it's all delicious. Into the hotel there are also some restaurants so if you don't want to go out for dinner you have many choises. Helpful and friendly staff. It's situated 10 minutes with taxi from Burj Khalifa and other turistic attractions. Excellent stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sawanladdha
Reviews.Content: Country Club Dubai is one of the good propertys i have seen of country club, they upgraded me to higher category room due to my membership with them and they have given good service all in all. all in all a 4 star hotel at the price of 3 star hotel. good swimming pool on terrace

Reviews.Title: “Un expected”
Reviews.Author: theED
Reviews.Content: I booked at the The Country Club Hotel Dubai, one coz it was more reasonably priced than many others considering it was a 4 star hotel and due to its relative proximity to where I was going to have my business. Truth be said I was not expecting much, as there are many 4 star hotels in Dubai which turn out to be run-down dumps. On my arival, all staff seemed friendly and welcoming, the lobby area did not impress me much it looked like a large corridor. The check in process (prepaid with booking.com) was fast, and we where informed that our rooms where upgraded, which was something I heard before from other hotels and turns out usually that it would just have a bigger bed, an extra chair or something insignificant. In this case however it meant I was moved to a 1 bedroom apartment which ad 2 full bathroom a large sitting area with an LCD and a decent size bedroom (I didn't mind it at all). However!! I painfully discovered when I returned from my meetings around 10pm that my room is directly over the night club... this I did mind. I went to the reception and I explained I did ask for the free music (Indian music) all night, he informed that the hotel was full but he will try to get me a room. I waited some 20 mins and a bell boy came to escort me to my new room which turned out to be another 1 br apt directly over the last one. And although I could still hear the music just not as loud I surrendered to the fact as I was too tired to argue. All in all the hotel was good, rooms where clean and specious (even the standard ones) and the attitude of staff is excellent. this hotel gets my Thumbs UP! j

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: bjaypee
Reviews.Content: The Country Club Hotel was booked by our travel agents. Since I had seen a 'mixed' opinions on this website and was traveling with a family of five adults [including an old lady of 78], was a bit apprehensive. But what a pleasant experience it turned out to be. Very comfortable rooms - we were given the rooms on the third floor with a view towards the New Gold Souk. What impressed most was the house keeping [Phillipino room boy?], every day the towels and sheets were changed - probably a luxury even in European and American hotels. Our hotel booking was on bed and breakfast basis. The breakfast [from 7 to 10 am ] on offer for all the four days we spent, was excellent and whole some. A wide variety of choices with plenty of fruits and friendly staff. Uttappams, Masala dosas, puries and somosas if you care for Indian food. Though, not very close to any major shopping malls, [Dubai Mall is 18.50 dhms from the hotel] taxis are available all the time at the hotel entrance. By the way, most of the taxi drivers are either Pakistanis or Indians and very friendly. Could not help imagining that if India and Pakistanis can co exist and help the tourism and other industries in Dubai to such great heights, we can achieve a lot if the same is applied in these countries [politicians - are you listening?] With a helpful Melisa at the reception desk and ever smiling bellboy Kirk, it was a sheer pleasure staying in Country Club Hotel. What we missed by default, probably is the spa and Kerala ayurvedic massages being offered at 50% concession to hotel room guests. By the way, book on line for better rates and take a cab from outside. If you believe in morning walks, take the route towards Al Karama. What made our trip to Dubai an excellent experience is the pleasant stay at this hotel. Wing Commander Bellie Jayaprakash - Bangalore

Reviews.Title: “This has got to be the WORST HOTEL I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: RJ R
Reviews.Content: I am staying here now! Feel would like to leave immediately out from this hotel! I do not recommend it - especially for families!!!!! Very noisy!!!!!!! If you wish to sleep in the night, PLS do not select this hotel! Because sleeping it's not possible in this hotel!! If you make a complain about noisy, you don't get response about it!!! This is not 4 star hotel! The persons at the reception is very rude! Bad customer service!! Pls stay away from this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “safe and sound stay.”
Reviews.Author: ARUNDOGRA
Reviews.Content: Last summer we stayed in this hotel. definetly not a 4 star hotel. It can be 3 star. as most of the area is occupied by rooms only. Breakfast arrangements were very good & it was complementry, we stayed 5 nights there. As I am royal resorts goa member so the booking and check in process was smooth and got a nice welcome. front office and hotel staff was very helping nature and polite (I like this very much in this hotel). Location wise also not a bad choice.can't expect all hotels in the mid city. it cost 10 /12 Dhs by taxi to any nearest Metro station. taxi is available easly. hotel loby has the desk for city tour and other tour packages , you can enquire and book through them. Disco / bar & Restaurant are average and I think it is slightly expensive, i think this is due to 4 star ratings. - Overall a nice stay with nice peoples.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not worthy of its 4 star status”
Reviews.Author: LondonSB
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in a deluxe double bed room during December. The hotel is located on the Port Rashid Road that can be easily accessed from the Al Mina Road as well. If you want to walk to an attraction or a shopping area then this is not the hotel for you. However, many areas in Bur Dubai, Karama, Deira can be easily accessed with a short taxi ride. The entrance to the hotel from the main road itself looked bit confused with couple of slip roads and then an untreated passage to the hotel car park. The car park itself is an open land which was sandy and dusty. Other vehicles and taxis travel through this to reach construction sites and other hotels I think. But you will always find a place to park which is a good thing. The double room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was also good size and neat. There were one king size double bed, two sofa chairs, a small table, another chair, kettle and tea making facility, safe, mini bar, plenty of storage and wardrobe space, bathroom slippers, etc as one would expect from such a hotel. Bedding and pillows were comfortable. Extra pillows and sheet were also available. Beds done and towels changed every day. BUT, the main issue we had was that the room smelled of cigarette smoke. So make sure you specifically ask for a ‘non-smoking’ room. We didn’t opt for the breakfast option so can’t comment on that. Had dinner at the Qureshis kebab & kurry restaurant. There was an Indian band singing kind of old Hindi songs. The food, though over priced, was good if not the best. Service was a bit slow but otherwise ok. There is a left luggage facility but the storage space allocated for a hotel of this size was very very small. Just few bags will fit in there. So they may even keep your bags near the travel desk next to the hotel entrance as they did in our case. Hotel staff were helpful when approached but don’t expect all the staff to throw smile at you or say hello. The walk to the elevator area is not so nice in my opinion. There is a restaurant and couple of bars near the elevator area and also the space in front of the lift is used for special buffet lunch occasions. Wifi access is available but there is a cost for that. We had other means so didn’t use the hotel’s. The reservation desk may provide some deals on this along with the room booking. So if you are thinking of using the hotel internet option then please email and deal with the reservation desk beforehand. Though the stay was ok, compared to hotels with similar facilities and standard in Europe, I don’t think it is worth of the 4 star status. Will I stay here again? Probably not due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “With a little less noise it could have been a 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: hafner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel recently, we were a couple and had booked the double room. As i was the country club, Dubai member so the booking process was easy. I knew people in Dubai so arriving here wasn't difficult. Location although not close to markets but yes with Taxi it's close to all the places, specially open beach. The Rooms were spacious enough, staff was nice but the only problem was the Passage from lobby to lift very cramped and noisy. Due to restaurants n bar. The worst was that i had requested a room at higher floor. But at check-in i was politely told that i have been upgraded to executive room; to my surprise it was on 1st floor . Room was good but hell!! it was noisy.. I could hear next room. Even worst was on our stay of 4 night every night we couln't sleep on time as there was loud noise of music coming from the Disc below and you could hear the clear songs..even till late at 1 AM.. And yes WIFI charges were exuberant starting 20 Dir .hour or so and you get complimentary mostly everywhere.. rest staff was very gud..all the amenities and housekeeping was good..

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarneyRubble2
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel situated within easy reach of most attractions. We hired a car for our weeks' holiday so it was really easy to get around (although caution about driving in Dubai as everyone drives fast and close to each other with late decisions about changing lanes or leaving the motorway!). Taxis are very cheap and a good alternative to driving yourself or driving to places with limited parking (although some taxi rides are not for the faint hearted). The hotel was clean and the staff were welcoming and helpful. We stayed on a B&B arrangement. The breakfast was buffet style, both hot and cold choices (fruit, meats, cheeses, breads, pastries, cereals, sausages, eggs, omelettes, etc). The hotel has a few bars and restaurants within it. We had 2 rooms in our group and one was above one of the nightclubs at the front of the building. Occupants of this room did have some noise from the nightclub and drivers drag racing on the road outside on a couple of nights, but did have an amazing view across to the city skyline. The other room was at the back of the hotel (no view) and had no noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Mold!!”
Reviews.Author: Milla M
Reviews.Content: The rooms were terribly moldy! Had to double my asthma medication for two weeks after a five night stay at this hotel. We changed the rooms but it didn`t help. Some of the staff were very unpolite for example the egg man at the breakfast. In the evenings at the lobby there were pimp kinda men just wandering around.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: dheerajkukreja
Reviews.Content: The Country club Hotel at Dubai is a fantatic hotel located at a location. A beautiful 4 star hotel with spacious rooms (much larger than a 4 star hotel or even I may say 5 star kind) and 6 dining options....you name it and they had it....English band and DJ at Sports bar "Player's Lounge", Russian band with Belly dancers at "Aqua", Philipino band with dancers at "Tia Maria", Indian speciality restaurant "Qureshi's" serving kebabs and curry with an Indian band. Indian Bollywood band with dancers at Bhughat....and off course coffee shop "Country cafe" , room service and on on ....The pool and spa at terrace makes the entire experience complete. I would always stay there and highly recommend....

Reviews.Title: “Moldy rooms”
Reviews.Author: E L
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for almost a week, after the first night we had to change rooms due to them being stuffy and moldy. Luckily the rooms on the backside were better, and more suitable for asthmatic travelers. The value for the price was ok, however, the next time I will be using a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Happy_travel1
Reviews.Content: At first arriving to the hotel, we were thinking " oh here we go, this is gonna be bad" as the car park is just a sandy field, and it is next to a busy road, next to the hospital. However, once we got in the hotel, although not super impressive, it looked nice, and the staff were really welcoming. After check in, we were shown to our room, which was very nice and clean, and with complimentary water provided every day. The only negative was that is was hard to regulate the air con.. The hotel has a roof top pool. Not the biggest, but nice. it also has a childrens pool and a jacuzzi, and waiter service.. What more do you need for a relaxing stay? (oh yes, they have a gym and a proper spa too :-) ). Amazed to see that what appeared to be a small hotel also had 4-5 restaurants and a couple of bars were also a pleasant surprise. You could choose from exotic foods from India or the Philipines, to just going to the English Sports Bar for a beer and a burger. The location of the hotel is perhaps not the best in sense of walking distances, but taxis are cheap, and you can get to anywhere for next to nothing. There are shopping malls in the area, or you can go to Dubai Mall (only 10-15 mins in a taxi). Was worth the stay and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay”
Reviews.Author: Marianne W
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel while passing through Dubai. I make my reservations using Expedia.com. Reserved an Executive Room consisting of a bedroom and seperate living room. Room also had TWO bathrooms. The hotel is about 10 minutes from the airport ($15.00) taxi ride. The food was excellent. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Yogesh R”
Reviews.Author: Yogi R
Reviews.Content: I always have a lovely stay and will always return. Lovely friendly staff, everything is impressive from check in to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Excellent Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Neeraj K
Reviews.Content: This month I visited Dubai on a business trip and after much of survey and review reading, I booked Country Club for a 4 day stay. I took a normal room and looking at the property, now I feel it was a good deal. As most of the reviewers have told the hotel is in Bur Dubai and bit away from the city. But plenty of taxis are available around the hotel. So, no problem with the location. The room was spacious, clean and had all the basic amenities. The room service was good, smiling staff and timely response. The hotel has many restaurants and pubs and I enjoyed the food at one of their Indian restaurant and spent couple of nights at their sports bar and Filipino bar. The buffet breakfast was good too. There are many other facilities including spa, gym and coffee shop and I also noticed a beauty parlour! Not bad for a 3 star property. The staffs were really helpful and cordial. All in all, it turned out to be a good trip. I certainly recommend this hotel for the people who are budget conscious. This hotel has some amazing facilities and gives very good service to its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay around”
Reviews.Author: Edward M
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The staff most importantly are extremely curtious and very helpful. The price is great, the rooms are wonderful and location also practical. Thank you so much staff of Country Club for making another enjoyable trip for me. See you again in 3 months.

Reviews.Title: “Lower end of the 4 stars - but still nice to stay at”
Reviews.Author: Suzieq3344
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conviently located about 15 minutes from basically everywhere! A short and cheap taxi from the airport, and located on a major road right near the Port Rashid. The New Gold Souk is directly behind the hotel, however stick to the Old Gold Souk if you are looking for a real experience. The hotel was clean, friendly (except when i wore long shorts one day - as a woman it's a no no) and has a range of restaurants and a cafe. Breakfast is fine for continental, and the tea/coffee comes quickly. The Indian restaurant was lovely, and the pub is good for hanging out in. The Spa and Health club is nice, only offers massage/facial treatments however there is an onsite hairdresser too. Downside is the nightclub on the ground floor. Good times for those who go there, but bad for the residents sleeping on ALL floors of the hotel. I was on the 3rd floor just below the health centre, and the room actually vibrates with the bass noise coming from the ground floor. This goes on quite late into the early morn, so if you are a light sleeper, choose wisely. Taxis go past all the time, there is an international hospital literally next door, and the shopping malls are all within a short cab rides distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seema S
Reviews.Content: We visited Dubai between 18th and 26th August 2011 and had an awesome time. We are Country Club members and had reserved our stay at their Country Club Hotel in Bur Dubai. It is a really good hotel with all the facilities that one needs for a good stay. The staffs are really friendly, service oriented and accommodative. The rooms are really luxurious and come loaded with all the modern facilities. The one that was reserved for us was beautifully designed, had very comfy beds, fridge, microwave and other regular facilities of any star hotel. This Country Club Hotel has many recreation and dining facilities including Indian restaurants, Filipino Club, an English Sports Bar, lounge bars and coffee shops. We enjoyed eating and listing to live Ghazal at their Qureshis Kabab and Curry restaurant and also tasted Filipino cuisine at Tiya Maria. Country Club Hotel provided all the facilities for our entire family including helping us in local sightseeing tour, currency exchange and airport pick-up and drop. Thanks to them, we had an awesome time in Dubai. I recommend this hotel to every one who wants to visit Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Fab stay”
Reviews.Author: Gladst0nes
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in July on bed and breakfast basis- food excellent and something for everyone. Collected from airport by lovely driver and delivered to hotel within 15 minutes. . The room was clean and more than adequate, sheets and towels were changed every day. Staff were very friendly and professional. Good base for sightseeing. Roof-top pool small but lovely and spa facilities were great. Only complaint would be our 15 year old son was not allowed into the lounges/bars and the music goes on until 3am. Would definately go back- with earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Yagneshj
Reviews.Content: Hotel is having multiple facilitiies under one roof from clubbing to accomodation and food with good quality. Rooms / suites are of good quality with excellent room services. needs to seperate clubbing from accomodation access especiaaly at night. rathe rhotel has very good accssible location - never get stuck up in DXB trafic - all day easy access. Hotel staff is very professional in services.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: raocsrao
Reviews.Content: Ambience is very good . The restuarant is excellet with food extraordinary. The service staff is very polite and good. The rooms are clean and tidy well maintained . The location is perfect and reachable from airport with in 20 mintutes

Reviews.Title: “Staff need to learn how to great customers and management need to stop bullying staff”
Reviews.Author: Pravin_colindale
Reviews.Content: Adequate near the airport hotel with restaurants, pool and evening entertainment. I stayed in 3 hotels on my trip. This had to be the most unfriendliest out of the three. Staff shortage means service suffered and couldn't cope when a large influx of people in 24 hour restaurant. The shortage meant, every time something was needed staff had to be summoned. Got a bit tiresome asking for someone to top up tea each time it was needed for example. Management style of staff was almost bordering on bullying. Almost no staff, from chamermaid to waiting staff looked into the guests eyes or genuinely greeted them. They actually looked down to the floor when you met one on the landing or the lobby. I witnessed a number of agruments from guests with front desk staff. Though I do commend the front desk staff for acting proffessionally from the onslaught of some guests. I genuinely felt sorry for majority of staff working at this hotel. The management of this hotel seriouly need to re-think how they treat their own staff and that their style of management feeds downs from the staff to guests. Live music from one of the restaurants coud be heard in the bedroom up to 0300 am. This did disturb my sleep

Reviews.Title: “good stay!!!helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ahmed_alghamdi
Reviews.Content: im ahmed alghamdi stay in your hotel it was very good stay when im there in dubai,good ambiance clean and helpful staff,the concierge is good that assist me going in the room and the receptionist ms juvy in the evening help me for my client i forgot her name i just remember that have a small eyes and shes only girl i see in the evening .i will come again to my next business regards to the good manager the egyptian man.

Reviews.Title: “Keep away. Im not fussy, but this is place took the p*ss”
Reviews.Author: Mishet
Reviews.Content: 1. Insects inside my mini bar and toilet 2. Rooms not cleaned properly. They only do the bed. No new towels, toilet roll, etc 3. Bed mattress broken and cut my wifes leg. They only gave me a first aid kit. 4. Couldnt sleep well as the hotel is next to the port which is open 24 hours so very noisy 5. Safari tour lady in reception charged my credit card twice and im now trying to get £166 back which was a duplicate payment. 6. Had to wait 6 hours before I could even check in when I first got to hotel. They told me to wait in reception or come back later. No complimentary coffee or tea either. 7. The gym staff are really bad The hotel only looks good in the pictures. Please dont be deceived.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: munaf61
Reviews.Content: Nice people, very helpful, great facility. Enjoy the stay and was back with fantastic memories. The guys came to the airport to receive us and also to drop us. Very co=operative staff and trustworthy too. If at all we plan to visit Dubai, it shall be this very same hotel for our stay. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: Kisn
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long trip from Europe,late Monday evening.The Hotel looked nice and we checked in.I was in bed around 03.00 and slept well until i get a wakeupcall from the reseption 06.00 wich i ofcourse didnt orderd.The second night around 04.00 a guy from the reseption was ringing on my doorbell.He was sent to pick up my luggage,and thought i was checking out? So there wasn`t much sleep the to first nights..I talked with the reseption about this matters,but they told me this things could happen. There where also a note in the room saying that from this day the pool was out of order. No date on it,but it looked like it had been there for quite some time.We were offered to use the pool on the Hotel near by.We had a looked but the pool was a dump.Lots of trash and dirty water! My parents had booked rooms with balcony,there werent any rooms with balcony. The Hotel had a pub and disco downstairs,which played very loud music every night so it wasnt easy to get a good night sleep.The location wasnt good eather,you had to get a taxi to get some place.There was no park or someplace to sit down ouside the Hotel,This is not a four star Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice”
Reviews.Author: marius1930
Reviews.Content: They were overbooked, and upgraded me to a suite of some kind, 1 bedroom, 1 livingroom, 2 bathrooms and a hallway. Got quite the value for my money! :) Room service was a bit lacking, and you're better off eating out, which can be tricky given it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, beautiful & Majestic‎”
Reviews.Author: bedroomincountryclub
Reviews.Content: After being a member of Countryclub, it was my first holiday trip to their location. Country club Dubai is located at the heart of Bur Dubai. Our stay in this hotel made our leisure trip more majestic. Food & ambience was excellent. Staffs were attendive. Looking for more holodays with The Country Club locations.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Vikasr
Reviews.Content: No problems with the Hotel at all. I travelled with my wife. We booked a basic room for 8 nights and were given a upgrade to an Executive Deluxe Room. I totally love the open air Jacuzzis on the roof top. Food is amazing. I really recommend this Hotel. It is a 4 Star Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Coraka
Reviews.Content: It is good place. I'm sure it's not too expensive if I think about other hotels in Dubai. It is an Indian hotel in Bur Dubai which is the business center of the city. If you'd like to be close to the skyscrapers, this is a good place to go. It is a nice atmosphere with nice people, there is a pool in the rooftop, sauna, gym and similar stuff. The room is great and you can smoke inside if you want. The funniest thing is that there is no wireless internet and you have to pay for the cable internet which is not working properly :)) Otherwise I'm not complaining at all

Reviews.Title: “Very poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: HasLondon
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was very bad. The staff were un-proffessional, unhelpful, very deceptive and corrupt. They wouldn't open the door for any guest who wasn't a hindu. The rooms had a strange smell and no view what so ever, just looking straight into a brick wall. Please avoid this hotel at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterJoan1948
Reviews.Content: We had booked one night prior to joining the Costa Emirates cruise and arrived at 9am, after an overnight flight, expecting to have to dump our cases and check in later; however we were immediately checked in and upgraded, enabling us to freshen up, breakfast, then pick up the Big Bus Tour. Breakfast is good, with unlimited supplies of tea, and our suite had a large and a smal bathroom, both with showers, the larger with a jacuzzi, and a TV in the lounge and bedroom. Bahrobes are provided. The hotel is very convenient for Port Rashid, but you do need a taxi for Dubai itself - but they're very cheap. We didn't have lunch/dinner here, but there were a variety of restaurants/bars. All the staff are very friendly and helpful, the facilities good, and we'd certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel, Staff very unprofessional!!”
Reviews.Author: soumyaharish07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 days as this hotel was recommended by southall travel agent. We thought it should be good as its a 4 star hotel and also very close to many tourist attractions. BUt to our surprise it was a very horrible hotel to stay in..rooms were ok & no hot water !! we were given hot water for shower in a big bucket and were given a dusbin to use as a can! First day we used kettle as a can, second day I had been to a spa near by and had shower there... When we complained about this to staff, we received a call from the manager saying "we are trying to sort out the problem and you have to be patient and its a human error we cant help" we were shocked! There is a restaurant, very expensive and food tastes hopeless! There is disco in the restaurant and its very noisy till 3-4am in the morning. The staff are very unfriendly and unhelpfull too. I don't recommend this to any one visiting Dubai for a holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Shocking Service - It's gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: UkFreqTraveller
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th stay at this Hotel over the last 18 months. When it was The Chelsea it offered good value for money. Since it's take over the service ( Reception, managment and some restaurants) has gone downhill dramatically. The reception staff are just rude and unhelful. It took 5 phone calls and 3 hours to get a cable to use the internet. Drinks and food have soared in price, ( we eat more chaply at the 5* Radisson ). The only good part is the indian restaurant where food and service are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Give this one a miss - 3 star hotel with appalling customer service”
Reviews.Author: scarey149
Reviews.Content: My company has been using this hotel for some time now (since back when it was the Chelsea Hotel) and this time will most definitely be the last! Considering it's Ramadan at the moment and the hotel is dead - the staff still get irritated by the smallest request or question because they just don't want to do anything to make your stay pleasant. They almost snarl at you everytime you ask them something! * The food is outrageously expensive and mostly inedible - we went into the Radisson Blu at Deira Creek and the food and alcohol was cheaper and fantastic! * If you can get onto the internet it's intermittant. * If you request a non-smoking room they will always try to put you into a smoking room (so just jump up and down a little and they will give in - they try it every single time!! However, on this occasion they also put us into standard twin rooms when we booked delux doubles just for their own amusement) * The noise from the extremely smokey bar downstairs will keep you awake all night - so don't forget the earplugs! * The reception staff and duty managers have to be the most obnoxious people I have ever come across in the hospitality industry (the waiting staff and cleaners are actually quite nice) * Management don't seem to give a toss if you're having a nice stay (they don't believe in the "customer is always right" theory) * We asked for a recommendation for a hotel close by that was serving food and alcohol (as it's ramadan there weren't many), they put us in a taxi and told the driver where to take us. It was only when we realised that he seemed to be driving for an extremely long time we asked where he was taking us and turns out we were heading for an expensive resort (Jumeirah Meridan) that was half an hour away!! We later worked out that they get a kick back from that resort as they also send guests there to use their beach (we only found that out when we went to use the pool and it was closed!). * The mini bar snacks are all out of date and overpriced - if you can even get the staff to top it up (mine was only done 2 out of 5 mornings on this trip) * There is NOTHING close to this hotel. If you want to do anything at all you need to get a taxi - yes, I know that the taxis are cheap but there are other areas you can stay where you can walk to other facilities that are close by. So basically - DON'T STAY HERE UNLESS YOU HAVE ABSOLUTELY NO OTHER OPTION!! IT MAY BE CHEAP BUT YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, the staff could not do enough to please us.”
Reviews.Author: stephie1988
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be of an excellent standard considering the price we paid. The hotel has a number of restaurants and bars downstairs, which meant that we did not have to go out if we didn't want to. My friend had a lovely massage in the roof top spa and I enjoyed getting my nails done in the downstairs salon. The area is still being built up, so there is not a lot to do in the immediate vicinity, however the bell boy and reception staff are more than happy to organise a taxi on request. The tourist desk made it easy to arrange excursions. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: anilmehndiratta
Reviews.Content: terrible hotel bad food terrible sevice not worth staying

Reviews.Title: “an oasis in the desert”
Reviews.Author: veebhe
Reviews.Content: u can find touch of the gulf , india &the far east. food was excellent ambeinece was good,service was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Too much noise / bad location”
Reviews.Author: Eskestad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not bad, and the rooms are actually fine. However, there are 2 BIG problems. 1. The location is bad. Although its in the middel of all the major things / experiences, there is really nothing close to the hotel. It is located in an industrial area, and you have to take taxi to all sites . There no restaurants within walking distance. 2. The biggest problem is noise. There are 4 bars / disco´s in the hotel. You can hear music ALL night (until 03.00). In addition you can also hear the sound of the elevator all night. So remember sleepingpills if you are going here.

Reviews.Title: “Good service in a pleasant, mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ed_the_explorer
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in Jan 2009. The location is okay since you have to use taxis anyway wherever you stay in Dubai. Perhaps it would be good if it was close to something that wasn't a taxi ride away but of course you would pay for that. The best thing about this hotel would be the friendliness of the staff. Each of them never failed to say 'morning, sir', 'afternoon, sir' or similar whenever encountered. Similarly, in the very nice health club they were falling over themselves to offer me a towel, point me in the direction of the showers or even wipe my sweat off the treadmill when I finished my workout! The pool on the roof is also very nice - long enough to do lengths plus space for sunbathers too. I was lucky enough to get a room upgrade owing to my field of employment (travel industry) so I can't comment on the value for money of a basic room. Needless to say, my room was very large and pleasant. Overall, I would recommend this hotel as a safe bet although it is only a mid-range hotel so not likely to blow your socks off in a 5-star sense. I should add this is the only hotel I've used in Dubai so I'm not able to give a comparison against the market.

Reviews.Title: “Change of name was surprise”
Reviews.Author: jaywtravel
Reviews.Content: Having read reports on this site on this hotel we were very concerned when we arrived in Dubai but we found the hotel to be good value for money. Our room was clean and spacious, the staff were very welcoming and nothing was too much trouble for them, they were very helpful. There was no difficulty getting taxis, the hotel was reasonably close to the airport and within a few minutes taxi journey of shopping malls. The name change was a difficulty as some taxi drivers did not recognise the new name (was the Chelsea Hotel). This was rectified by the hotel giving us a card with the name and a small map. Overall a very friendly hotel and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value for money option to stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Tequila007
Reviews.Content: First to mention - hotel changed its name into Country Club Hotel Dubai. The hotel is not wow, actually nothing to do with all great hotels around Jumeirah, even Deira etc. But for given price we paid it's very good option how to stay in Dubai. The rooms are quite ok - Indian, little overdecorated style, huge, with nice, new bathrooms. The breakfast is good enough to fill stomach in the morning. Reception quite slow and not really helpful. But I wouldn't mind to take my family there at all. (This is my usual criteria for acceptable and not acceptable hotel) The location is not great either, no nice views, just roads and other rather older buildings around So I would say good value for money (we paid 350 AED in July, 400 AED in August 08 for double with breakfast), which is great price for Dubai

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel and the staff made it even worse”
Reviews.Author: saroccer
Reviews.Content: First, the hotel lobby smelled musty and looked old. The rooms were not much better but bearable. The bathrooms were clean. I didn't eat there because the floor of the hotel restaurant (adjoining the business center) was sticky. I also had significant problems with the internet. When I got there, the young ladies at the reception desk were rude and did not smile at all. They also complained loudly about the 'stupid' customers calling them and asking them 'very stupid' questions. Definitely not welcoming. I could not access the internet in my room and the reception offered no support whatsover. I went downstairs to the lobby and asked for help or a refund. They initially refused to do either. I then went to the business center. The only thing going for them was the lady there. I believe her name was 'Miss Blossom'. She was helpful when the hotel's own computers didn't connect to the internet. She let me use her computer (I had 2 urgent emails to send) at no charge. The only other helpful person was a young man at the reception (I only saw him once) who helped me get a taxi. The hotel is close to a nice mall. That is one of it's only highlights. I don't recommend this hotel at all. Especially not for the price.

HotelInfo.Name: Country Club Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Behind New Gold Souk, Port Rashid Road, Dubai 118094, United Arab Emirates (Formerly Chelsea Hotel)
